body_content.explanation: the act of walking around a building or area, checking that there is no trouble or danger there:
examples: A soldier on foot patrol told him to pull over and asked him where he was going.
The police now carry out foot patrols when the bars are closing.

body_content.explanation: a small group of people, especially soldiers or police officers, who walk around a building or area, checking that there is no trouble or danger there:
examples: Foot patrols stop and chat to local people.
He worked his way up from the foot patrol to a squad car.
